pros:
Great leadership is committed to building an inclusive organization. 
There are a lot of interesting projects. 
Opportunities to work full time and from anywhere, literally anywhere.
The organization is growing fast.
cons: Casual hours can be irregular.

pros: The faculty, staff and students. We all see the same stuff but no one is listening to any of us.
cons: NorQuest is the most toxic environment I have ever worked and I've worked for government. Leaders at NorQuest are extensively abusive. They manipulate faculty and staff and refuse to listen to the needs of their teams. The college continually turns a blind eye to these activites making excuse after excuse for repeat offenders. Groups of students are allowed to be increasingly abusive to faculty and staff with zero repercussions because money is more important than the safety of employees and the majority of the students. Workloads on faculty and staff have been ludicrous. Student applications are being accepted with zero planning and last minute emergency hires. Onsite classes have no classrooms available for use because hyflex classes for some reason need an entire room for no student ts to actually attend the classes. This organization is literally collapsing and none of the leaders are paying any attention.

review_title: Great Place to start in Post Secondary
job_title: Planning Scheduling Technician in Edmonton, AB
pros: GREAT Benefit Plan, one of the better plans out there. Covers nearly everything. Additional Dental, additional Health, life insurance, accident insurance etc. Lots of opportunity to move to different positions within the college (lateral moves) Hybrid workstyle, but must be in office a minimum of twice a week. Student facing or not.
cons: No opportunity to move up in position Top heavy, lots of managers and not enough people doing the work. Work load is ever increasing with the bare minimum to do the work. Always working 110% Staff feed back is heard but not acted on. Generally a great place to start in Post Secondary but staff is always moving on to other institutions after a while. A ton of reorganization/turn over.

pros: Wonderful company culture, flexible work hours, my leader is supportive, encouraging and empathetic.
cons: Salaries are very low in comparison to other PSI's. People train and become great at their jobs, then leave to go to NAIT/UoA/Grant Macewan. This HAS to change. Staff need to be paid more.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Edmonton, AB
pros: The new management is trying to grow and incorporate their long lasting values - but this time for real. Long road ahead but appreciate the effort
cons: Still a long way to go to create an atmosphere that will include everyone equally. Departments disconnected among themselves

review_title: Great organization, need to pay employees what they are worth
pros:
- Great volunteer opportunities
- Great place to network internally
- Fun events
- Informative workshops
cons: The Student Services process is a mess and is constantly being updated and our frontline staff at the desk are burned out due to the fact that the leadership team refuses to analyze the cracks and make our jobs easier.

pros: Decent wages, some kind people, and the ability to flex working on-site and working from home was great.
cons: Management was not great: no direct supervision, no job training, job descriptions, or guidance at all on how to do your job, the expectations or what to work on. It can be quite cliquey, old staff vs new staff when it comes to leads, support, and job opportunities (lots of nepotism). Gives the appearance of a positive workspace, but there is a lot of toxic positive without a lot of actual problem-solving when issues come up. When brought issues up to management was just told I was doing a great job - rather than any support with getting past the issues.

pros: No pros, didn’t enjoy my experience
cons: No Staff support from senior chair

job_title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst in Edmonton, AB
pros:
- Great culture that folsters kindness, honest conversations and embraces diversity/inclusion and excellence/innovation
- Hybrid work arrangement
- Promote work life balance and mental wellness
cons: Not really a con. Budgets are tight due to shrinkage in provincial funding and in revenues due to Covid - something we can get through.

review_title: Few advancement opportunities, staff underappreciated, group think rampant
pros:
Great team members
Opportunities to learn new software
cons:
Very limited opportunities for advancement
Disconnect from executive
Group think, staff afraid to speak up

job_title: Human Resources Manager in Edmonton, AB
pros: Purpose driven, high quality educational institution.
cons: Government funding challenges impair the organization's ability to realize its mission.

pros: GETS UPDATED WITH EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES
cons: some job offers doesnt match qualifications

pros: Career growth and development, work life balance, start up environment, very flexible !
cons: None right now, great organization to be a part of!

pros: Love my boss, get lots of leadership opportunities and get to volunteer for different inititatives
cons: Communication between departments could be better.

review_title: Poor employer. The institution is characterized by corruption and chaos.
pros: Salary, benefits , new building, central location.
cons: Corrupt leadership, poor quality instruction, poor professional ethics.

job_title: Senior Executive Associate in Edmonton, AB
pros: Great culture full of fantastic people.
cons: Lack of career progression opportunities in some roles.

pros: Best College ever, I enjoyed my time there teaching. The work atmosphere was amazing, friendly team.
cons: I wish this college was in Ontario, I would never have left this college. I still miss working there to this day.

review_title: Teaching Nursing at NorQuest is a Dream Job!
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Edmonton, AB
pros: Great hours! Leadership educator role! Inspiring the minds of future nurses! Excellent benefits! Pay is rated by scale.
cons: Overcoming language barriers for international students.

job_title: Learning Commons Student Navigator in Edmonton, AB
pros: good team working environment, diversity
cons: there is less communication across departments

pros: Great diverse set of individuals, team work and inclusion
cons: Could do much better by paying attention their employees.

pros:
- Clear strategic direction
- Strong appetite for innovation
- Encourages staff growth and professional development
- Lots of opportunities for self-starters
cons:
- Business processes are not as mature as one would expect
- Demand exceeds capacity, particularly as the college grows

pros: The People and Students .
cons:
Horrific Executive Leadership- Incompetent in practice, leadership and knowledge as evidence the many news clips CBC and the numbers of colleagues who have resigned.
Fail to uphold the collective agreement as they influence and intimidate the Faculty Association.
Poor example of leaders: Google Norquest in the News for all the headlines to support the cons: Alberta's Brightest as per Board Chair Statement in 2016- comments on his rationale for pay of CEO! Alberta Taxpayers REVIEW the notes and speak up !!!

review_title: Lots of good, some significant concerns
job_title: Higher Education Administrator in Edmonton, AB
pros: Lots of great people work at NorQuest and have a shared goal of helping improve students' lives. Most people work together very well. NorQuest has invested in improving the campus. The Executive Team is trying to create conditions for the culture of the college to improve.
cons: Relentless pressure to grow (hit enrolment targets and increase revenue) leads to unsustainable work loads, staff burnout and an environment where growth goals trump doing things the right way. This is enabled and encouraged from the top. It's especially evident in the international student space, where pressure to increase revenue leads to poor (and sometimes unethical) business practices.

pros:
- I love my team and the flexibility I have in my position
- Our division is growing rapidly and my position feels secure
- My colleagues and I really care about students
- There are a lot of opportunities to learn new skills and be exposed to new projects
- I am incredibly pleased with the new direction the college is going in and the strategic plan and vision resonates with me
cons:
- There is a lot of opportunity to revamp the employee orientation, I did not feel the employee orientation was sufficient.
- There are a lot of silos between departments, even though everyone is in an open cubicle environment, there is not a lot of everyday communication between colleagues in different departments
- Certain departments within the college could be doing more to market the college to students and industry
- Because of dependency on government funding there is a level of uncertainty
- Some procedures could be made more efficient
- Registrar's Office is not as welcoming to students as it could be

review_title: Incredible culture with passionate leaders, faculty and staff who want to make a difference
pros: Career pathing, employee development ( we have a professional development fund that all employees can apply for to support their training needs and a college wide learning day where the entire college shuts down and goes offsite for a customized day of learning!) and very good benefits ( flexible choice levels and health spending account) and vacation.  The college participates in a variety of wellness activities ( yoga, massage therapist, retirement pension planning, winter walks, Xmas movies with popcorn). This college is making a difference for those students it serves and building an incredible culture for its employees
cons: There is limited government funding ( or our funding levels haven't changed in the tuition model for PSI 's in the last 5 years) so requirement to find other revenue levers........ is just part of what we do

review_title: A company on the right path!
job_title: Student Program Administrator in Edmonton, AB
pros:
- Good benefits
- GREAT People
- Focus on people culture and really breaking down silos and collaboration
- Very student focused 
- Very good environment, support for growth within organization
- very focused on professional development of staff (wonderful in house training!)
- lots of opportunities if you are with a supportive supervisor and team
cons:
- some folks are overworked and some don't have enough to do. Need to get the balance right because overworked folks start to burnout and its frustrating to watch others not do much
- very process heavy, need to make them efficient and work on streamlining. (already aware of this and trying to work on it) 
- Union negotiator is useless, needs to be replaced

review_title: NorQuest is a wonderful organization that is going through a significant change - for the better.
pros: The people working at NorQuest are some of the best you'll find anywhere. Truly student-centred, dedicated, warm. NorQuest plays a key role in the Alberta college system. We offer much needed programming to members of under represented populations who are essential to our economy and society. Very important work that benefits everyone.
cons: We are changing and trying to leave old attitudes and practices behind. There are still people here that are stuck in the old mud. They don't understand the changes that are needed or they just don't want to progress. These employees hinder what the organization needs to do and frustrate those that 'get it'.

pros: Passionate employees with a clear understanding that they change lives, make a difference in the communities they serve, and who want to be the best they can be.
cons: Still grossly under the influence of government funding, policy and such, and often must pivot to accommodate government which impacts the work we do, our ability to be nimble, and even our employee salaries. Change exhaustion may become a factor when implementing an aggressive growth strategy. But promises to be exciting as well!

pros: In more than multiple decades, I have never worked at an post-secondary that so passionately serves its learners and continuously strives to create an inclusive learning environment while maintaining its small but mighty feel. NorQuest was not only a place of work for me but a family.
cons: Sadly, it seems to be getting more challenging to keep supports for NorQuest learners in place. Yes, the new building may assist but funding is critical to ensure a supportive learning environment is manintained - otherwise, it's just a building.

review_title: Upper management creates competition amongst staff to make individuals work harder
pros: People are friendly. The new renovations are beautiful!
cons: Constant threat to position. Have to apply for own job on a regular basis. Yet constant advertisement for more faculty on website = resulting in feeling of incompetency amongst staff. Admin staff give orders and when they feel they are working too hard, they download work onto the faculty. If faculty make recommendations to help ease workload, admin staff create more reports for faculty to complete. Results = silences faculty.

review_title: Great place to work, constant fear of cutbacks and layoffs
pros: Inclusive, active, supportive, large organization with lots going on, energy from students, opportunities for training, and education.
cons:
Job security is the biggest issue. Constant concerns of cutbacks, restructuring and changes that come from the provincial budget. Having worked there for a decade this was always a constant pressure. 
Large organization with potentially lots of layers to get lost under and minimalize your impact, voice or input.

review_title: Good entry-level position & good organization in terms of business processes,
pros:
- Downtown location 
- Great health benefits
- public pension
- Good work/life balance
- School vacations
- Available training for employees
- Great people including managers, directors & dean
cons:
- A lot of politics
- Expensive parking
- Lower salary compared to other institutions
- Outsourcing

pros: Good team dynamics. Willingness to do things different. Open minded. Interconnection with other departments.
cons: not too many opportunities to move up.

pros:
Great work environment
Fantastic colleagues
Management interested in improving the culture
Good benefits
cons: Pay freeze for the last three years--not even cost of living increases. Salaries are kind of mediocre to start with and now we get the equivalent of a pay cut every year.

review_title: There are better places out there
pros: Reasonable pay, benefits and job security.
cons: Low morale and disengaged employees. Favouritism, little room for career growth, recently fired 10% of its workforce.

pros: Innovative vision for growth and change in what is normally a traditional industry.  Brilliant and dedicated faculty that are very diverse and inclusive.  Excellent benefits and work/life balance.
cons: Fast growth sometimes causes growing pains but those challenges all seem to be overcome.

pros: Great people, very collaborative, good pay and good vacation allowance. Easy going atmosphere.
cons: Limited government funding, can be hard to progress and budget for future,

pros: Good team to work with
cons: The commute is a little longer coming from the southside area. Trying to avoid taking public transportation because of covid, so driving is the alternative way but parking downtown can be expensive.

review_title: Student Services - "It's the way we've ALWAYS done it"!
job_title: Student Services Representative in Edmonton, AB
pros: I have nothing positive to say, which is completely out of the "norm" for me.
cons:
Management bullies anybody under a Senior Manager/Manager role.
Students are rude, some are quite violent and dangerous.

pros: Great leadership, lots of collaboration across areas, innovative thinkers, flexible and adaptable!
cons: Just like any workplace, some long-timers who are bitter and antagonistic.

pros: Secure position. work-life balance opportunities. It is transforming and developing.
cons: Traditional Thinking. In need of a cultural shift. Policy and process heavy.

review_title: Great place to work most of the time
pros: Excellent people to work with
cons: Lots of internal upheaval.   Watch your back.

pros: you learn a lot, chances to grow in your role/ company
cons: work culture is not good

pros: Friendly and collegial.  Good future prospects.  They are expanding
cons: Somewhat lower pay but more vacation, so it evens out.

pros: Great environment, great students, and great faculty and staff,
cons: Never enough funding. To do everything we want them to.

pros: Great coworkers, work-life balance, location.
cons: While it's a great place to work otherwise, there isn't much opportunity for career advancement.
